overview_of_class: Gas laws and properties; kinetic theory; first, second, and third laws; phase equilibria; mixtures, phase diagrams, statistical thermodynamics, kinetics.
name: Physical Chemistry for ISP
title: WCAS CHEM 348-0-20 Physical Chemistry for ISP

descriptions.name: Overview of class
descriptions.value: Gas laws and properties; kinetic theory; first, second, and third laws; phase equilibria; mixtures, phase diagrams, statistical thermodynamics, kinetics.

descriptions.name: Registration Requirements
descriptions.value: Prerequisites: ISP enrollment; CHEM 172; MATH 281-1,2,3; or consent of department.

descriptions.name: Teaching Method
descriptions.value: Lectures, a textbook and supplemental materials will be the primary means of information transfer. Problem sets to be worked outside of the class will be assigned each week.

descriptions.name: Evaluation Method
descriptions.value: There will be 5 or 6 quizzes and one final exam covering the course material. Performance on homework problems will also be a part of the grade.

descriptions.name: Class Materials (Required)
descriptions.value: "Physical Chemistry," Peter Atkins and Julio de Paula, W.H. Freeman, 9th Edition

descriptions.name: Class Materials (Suggested)
descriptions.value: "Solutions Manual for Physical Chemistry," Peter Atkins and Julio de Paula, W.H. Freeman, 9th Edition

subject: CHEM
